reviewable.title: って
reviewable.nuance:
[casual quotation]

[If って is preceded by an ん, the っ is dropped (何なんって言いった → 何なんて言いった)]

exampleSentences.content: 彼（かれ）は「彼女（かのじょ）は綺麗（きれい）な人（ひと）だ」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.translation: He said, “She is a beautiful person”.
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/彼は「彼女は綺麗な人だ」って言った。.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 先生（せんせい）は「おはよう！」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/先生は「おはよう！」って言った。.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 「明日（あした）は雨（あめ）が降（ふ）りますか」って聞（き）いた。
exampleSentences.translation: I asked, “Is it going to rain tomorrow?”
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/06-明日は雨が降りますかって聞いた.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 彼（かれ）は「晩（ばん）ごはんを捨（す）てた」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.translation: He said, “I threw away my dinner”.
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/09-彼は晩ご飯を捨てたといった.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 「何時（なんじ）からですか」って聞（き）いた。
exampleSentences.translation: I asked, “What time is it from?”
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/03-何時からですかって聞いた.mp3

exampleSentences.content: お母（かあ）さんは「危（あぶ）ない！」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/01-お母さんは危ないって言った.mp3

exampleSentences.content: あの人（ひと）が「あなたは綺麗（きれい）ではない」って言（い）っていました。
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/あの人が「あなたは綺麗では.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 「北海道（ほっかいどう）から新幹線（しんかんせん）で来（き）た」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.translation: He said, “I came from Hokkaido by bullet train”.
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/04-北海道から新幹線できたって言った.mp3

exampleSentences.content: 「乾杯（かんぱい）！」って言（い）いたい。
漢字（かんじ）で「しょうゆ」って書（か）いて。
exampleSentences.nuance: [しょうゆ is soy sauce]・[denotes quotation]

exampleSentences.content: 「明日（あした）は雨（あめ）」って書（か）いた。
私（わたし）は「ここでは遊（あそ）ばない！」って言（い）った。
exampleSentences.male_audio_url: https://dk3kgylsgq3k1.cloudfront.net/audio/N5/Lesson6/358/male_audio/10-私はここでは遊ばないって言った.mp3

writeups.body:
って is a casual variation of the と particle that is used for quoting something. This use is called 引用（いんよう） in Japanese, which basically translates to 'reference', or 'citation'. って is almost exclusively used after direct quotations, and will be followed by a verb indicating what type of communication was used. 言（い）った, 思（おも）った, 聞（き）いた, for example.
  • 「行（い）ってきます」ってママが言（い）った。
    Mom said, 'I'll be back soon'.
  • 「それは危（あぶ）ないよ」って先生（せんせい）が言（い）った。
    The teacher said, 'That is dangerous'.
Just like with と, the verb that comes after って is frequently omitted. This is even more true for って, as many things are omitted in casual language.
  • トムは「今日（きょう）休（やす）む」って。
    Tom said he was going to take the day off today.
Caution
Although often heard, due to って being very casual, it can be considered unnatural to use in sentences that also use the です or ます polite structures. However, if the conversation is formal but friendly (like between a senpai and a kouhai), most people would consider it normal.

offlineResources.source: [DBJG] A Dictionary of Basic Japanese Grammar
[AIAIJ] An Integrated Approach to Intermediate Japanese

supplementalLinks.description: Said in Japanese (と言った vs って言ってた)
Using 「って」 as a casual version of 「と」

related_grammar_point.title: といってもいい
related_grammar_point.meaning: you could say, you might say

related_grammar_point.title: んだって
related_grammar_point.meaning: I heard that, He/She said that

seo.base-description: Japanese grammar study using SRS smart flashcards, tons of example sentences, audio, cram, textbook paths and more!

seo.review-description: Review the grammar and vocabulary in your study pile. Sign up to start using this feature.
seo.summary-description: Provides summaries of your last review session, breaking down items by difficulty, type, and so on. Sign up to start using this feature.
seo.learn-description: Learn new grammar and vocabulary, and then quiz yourself on it to add it to your SRS study list. Sign up to start using this feature.
seo.gp-index-description: In need of a quick refresher or looking for a specific grammar point? The Bunpro Grammar Archive lets you quickly search through all of our available grammar to find what you need.
seo.reviewable-description-fallback: Bunpro utilizes in-house explanations, example sentences, and a powerful SRS to teach you everything you will ever need to know about {{value}}.

form.japanese-caption: Include four underscores ____ where the answer should go. Use full-width parentheses after a kanji to add furigana, like this: 漢字（かんじ）
form.english-details: Bold will highlight the grammar in the sentence
